file_content.text: Go ahead. Call the man you owe a debt to. See if he answers.
Boruush? Boruush!
He's gone.
Now imagine: if my people can do that to your enemies over the course of this conversation, what do you suppose they can do to you?
All right. We sell carbonite prisoners.
It's been a pleasure doing business.
Uploading files now.
I see you've also had financial difficulties.
You lie.
I don't believe so. You've racked up quite a debt to some Trandoshan pirates. Does your crew know you've been gambling?
Maybe I make sure you don't tell.
Or maybe I do you a favor. By the time we're finished here, your creditors will be gone.
Not possible. Maybe I prefer you gone.
Sending now.
Why should we not sell to the Republic?
For one thing, I have files right... here showing that you destroyed a Republic transport last year.
What?
Video evidence from your own ship.
How you get this?
It fell into my hands. I'm sure there's more where that came from.
Why you want frozen prisoners?
Republic carbonite freezing units are superior to my client's. Keep the prisoners--I only need the boxes.
Do we look like jailers?
Then we'll dump the bodies ourselves. Just don't expect us to pay extra.
Maybe we sell it all back to the Republic.
Oh, I'm sure I can find a reason for you not to do that.
I'm done deleting evidence. Sending files shortly.
I'm going into the meeting now--keep moving, don't get caught, and delete all records of the raid on the prison transport.
Any files that might provide leverage, send to me.
Understood.
Ah, you must be Trademaster Kavork of the Red Meteor Consortium.
Yes. And you are little human who wishes to trade.
I understand you acquired items from a prison transport recently. I'd like to buy the lot.
